intro: Baphia brevipedicellata, commonly known as the short-stemmed baphia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Baphia brevipedicellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local communities.
